title: Link to download not found
body:
Hi, 
the link for downloading MUSIC.zip does not work - (https://github.com/gersteinlab/MUSIC/blob/master/MUSIC.zip) 
Thanks!

title: Consider using getopt or gflags for command line flag parsing
body:
First of all, very interesting project!

I noticed that there is a lot of boilerplate code used for parsing command line arguments. I think that this can be greatly simplified by using a command line argument parsing library, such as [getopt](http://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Getopt.html) or [Google's gflags](https://code.google.com/p/gflags/?redir=1).

title: Installation issue
body:
Hello,

I am very interested in trying out MUSIC with our MNase-seq datasets. However I return an error when installing the package. Any suggestions you might have regarding how this could be resolved would be greatly appreciated. 

Thank you

[ba0287@mtx3 MUSIC-master]$ make clean
rm -f src/main.o src/ms_peak_calling_utils.o src/ms_mapped_read_tools.o src/ms_nomenclature.o src/ms_gsl_fft_filter_utils.o src/ms_annot_region_tools.o src/ms_signal_track_tools.o src/ms_signal_enrichment_utils.o src/ms_genome_sequence_tools.o src/ms_profile_normalization.o src/ms_combinatorics.o src/ms_nucleotide.o src/ms_min_max_utils.o src/ms_xlog_math.o src/ms_utils.o src/ms_ansi_cli.o src/ms_ansi_string.o src/wavfile.o  bin/MUSIC
[ba0287@mtx3 MUSIC-master]$ make
Compiling src/main.o
In file included from /usr/include/stdio.h:929:0,
                 from src/main.cpp:1:
/usr/include/bits/stdio.h: In function '__ssize_t getline(char*_, size_t_, FILE_)':
/usr/include/bits/stdio.h:118:52: error: '__getdelim' was not declared in this scope
   return __getdelim (__lineptr, __n, '\n', __stream);
                                                    ^
makefile:10: recipe for target 'src/main.o' failed
make: *_\* [src/main.o] Error 1

title: error: libc++abi.dylib: terminating with uncaught exception of type std::bad_alloc: std::bad_alloc
body:
Hi, I'm getting some use out of MUSIC, but unfortunately run into this crash from time to time, here is an example command, with it's output:

``` sh
MUSIC -get_multiscale_broad_ERs \
      -chip music/E067-H3K27me3/dedup \
      -control music/E067-Input/dedup \
      -l_p 0 \
      -mapp multimap_36bp \
      -l_mapp 50 \
      -q_val 0.01
```

I have successfully run `MUSIC -get_per_win_p_vals_vs_FC` before this command. And it doesn't happen every time.

title: Could not load the chromosome id's for the chip data.
body:
Hi I am having some trouble with MUSIC.
I can not figure out if the package is pre-recognising that the files I have are already in SAM format and do not require pre-processing. I would save me a lot of processing time if I don't have to convert the files back to BAM files
Also is it possible that I can specify the paths directly to the input files rather than to the directories that contain them....?

ATTEMPT:
MUSIC -get_multiscale_broad_ERs -chip SAM1/ -control SAM2/ -mapp Mappability_36bp -l_mapp 36 -begin_l 1000 -end_l 16000 -step 1.5

## directories SAM1 and SAM2 both contain a single SAM file.
ERROR:
Could not load the chromosome id's for the chip data.

title: Please consider adding a license
body: Currently, there is no mention of a license in any of the files.  This makes the software proprietary by default.  Please consider releasing the code under a free software license and adding license headers to the source files.

title: Consider creating a tagged release
body:
Dear Ozgun,

I would like to add MUSIC to [bioconda](https://bioconda.github.io/), a channel for the [conda](https://conda.io/docs/) package manager specializing in bioinformatics software. To do so, we would like to have a tagged release with a git tarball for MUSIC. A tagged release adds version stability and we would not have to clone from untagged git revisions.
So, please consider creating a tagged release under the *Release* section of your repository.

Thanks a lot!
Jens

title: Bug in generate multimappability script
body:
There seems to be a bug in the portion of the 'generate_multimappability_signal.csh' script that generates 'temp_map_reads.csh' file. The path to bowtie2 index is concatenated with output directory path and the 'temp_map_reads.csh' scripts fails to run. It's fixable with sed but it gives one step extra.

Initializing mappability script:
```~/software/music/bin/generate_multimappability_signal.csh \
~/software/genomes/bowtie2/fasta/dm6.fa \
76 \
~/software/genomes/bowtie2/dm6 
```

Content of generated temp_map_reads.csh
```
MUSIC -fragment_sequence_2_stdout /home/Music-test/mappability/dm6_76bp/temp/2L.bin 76 read | bowtie2 -x /home/Music-test/mappability/dm6_76bp//home/software/genomes/bowtie2/dm6 -k 5 -p 4 -f -S /dev/stdout -U /dev/stdin | MUSIC -preprocess SAM stdin /
home/Music-test/mappability/dm6_76bp/temp/2L
MUSIC -fragment_sequence_2_stdout /home/Music-test/mappability/dm6_76bp/temp/2R.bin 76 read | bowtie2 -x /home/Music-test/mappability/dm6_76bp//home/software/genomes/bowtie2/dm6 -k 5 -p 4 -f -S /dev/stdout -U /dev/stdin | MUSIC -preprocess SAM stdin /
home/Music-test/mappability/dm6_76bp/temp/2R
...
...
```
